chat_history.content: Write a short, only slightly (around 10%) sarcastically funny in the style of Rick Riordan, and quantitative news story with lots of bolded numbers on 'american idol top 5' with a bolded title that does not contain quotation marks nor slashes and has each word starting with a capital letter, multiple twists and turns, less than 50 words for each paragraph, with each body (not title!!) paragraph's bolded words surrounded with and so it translates to html, no bolded words nor tags in the title, the first two sentences should concisely summarize the entire story, and end each paragraph and the title with a string '+++++', make sure to end the title with string '+++++' by summarizing this article: "American Idol" has narrowed the competition down to just five competitors. Since it's been too long (a month) since the ABC show repeatedly hit viewers over the head with Disney brand cross-promotion, "Idol" brought back the apparent fan-favorite Disney Night. And this year's edition comes with an extra dose of the House of Mouse, as it spans two episodes. In the first half of May 11's Episode 16, Lin-Manuel Miranda helped the Top 7 contestants strike the right chord with beloved songs from the Disney and Pixar film archive. Then an "Alice in Wonderland" outfit-wearing Carrie Underwood realized she would be struggling to contain her emotions for the second half, when the aspiring stars took the stage with their Mother's Day tributes. Sweet moments such as Breanna Nix trembling and pushing herself to finish Lauren Alaina's "Like My Mother Does" and Thunderstorm Artis serenading his wife Faith with an original song inspired by her gave way to a serious moment when the fan vote for the Top 5 sent two contestants packing. Read on for what happened in Episode 16. Need a break? Play the USA TODAY Daily Crossword Puzzle. What happened last episode? Judges save a contestant and send another home for the Top 7 Ryan Seacrest has 'never been more depressed to be single' Thunderstorm sang to Faith in the crowd as she stood beside their older son and cradled their younger son who was strapped to her chest. As he crooned about her green eyes and their serendipitous meeting "Out of The Blue" (the song's title, of course), she appeared to tear up. Faith wasn't the only one in her feelings about his song. "I've never been more depressed to be single than in this moment," host Ryan Seacrest deadpanned after reciting some of Thunderstorm's lyrics. Who was sent home on 'American Idol?' After a long journey on the "Idol" circuit, the show lost its youngest competitor, Mattie Pruitt, and Baltimore's Gabby Samone. Who is in the 'American Idol' Top 5? Your goal is to keep the reader curious and guessing at what comes next at the end of each paragraph.

American Idol Has Narrowed The Competition Down To The Top 5 Contestants, But Not Without A Dramatic Two-Episode Disney Night. After A Month Of Cross-Promotion, The Show Brought Out Lin-Manuel Miranda And A Lot Of Emotions—And A Few Tears Were Shed.+++++ In Episode 16, The Top 7 Took Center Stage For A Magical Disney Night, Which Featured A Stunning 100% Heartfelt Performances. Lin-Manuel Miranda, The One And Only, Was There—No, He Didn't Rap About Mice—But He Did Help Contestants Belt Out Iconic Disney Hits. Guess Who Totally Didn’t Cry? Carrie Underwood!+++++ Sweet Summery Tunes Filled The Air As Breanna Nix Attempted To Finish 110% Of Lauren Alaina’s "Like My Mother Does" Without Turning Into A Mess. Meanwhile, Thunderstorm Artis Serenaded His Wife Faith And Their Children, Leaving Ryan Seacrest Wondering Why He Was Still Single At 27 Years Old. Should We Send Him A Disney Princess?+++++ But After A Tenor-ific Performance, The Fan Vote Arrived Like A Rampaging Caterpillar, And Two Contestants Went Home—Mattie Pruitt, Who Was Allegedly A Connoisseur Of Glitter, And Baltimore’s Gabby Samone. They Joyfully Left The Stage, Not Knowing That Heartbreak Was Only A Number Away: 2 Contestants Gone. Who Will The Top 5 Be? Stay Tuned!+++++

Write a short, only slightly (around 10%) sarcastically funny in the style of Rick Riordan, and quantitative news story with lots of bolded numbers on 'italian open emma raducanu bianca andreescu' with a bolded title that does not contain quotation marks nor slashes and has each word starting with a capital letter, multiple twists and turns, less than 50 words for each paragraph, with each body (not title!!) paragraph's bolded words surrounded with and so it translates to html, no bolded words nor tags in the title, the first two sentences should concisely summarize the entire story, and end each paragraph and the title with a string '+++++', make sure to end the title with string '+++++' by summarizing this article: ROME - Canada's Bianca Andreescu is through to the fourth round of the Italian Open WTA 1000 tennis tournament after posting a 6-2, 6-4 victory over No. 11 seed Elena Rybakina of Kazakhstan on Sunday. Andreescu, a 24-year-old from Mississauga, Ont., converted three break points and saved five to win the third-round match in one hour 27 minutes. The 2019 U.S. Open champion is back on the comeback trail after recently returning from nearly six months off the WTA Tour. Currently ranked 121st, Andreescu earned her first win against a top-20 opponent since 2023 on Friday with a 6-1, 3-6, 6-2 victory against Donna Vekic of Croatia in the second round. Rybakina hadn't dropped a set in three previous meetings with Andreescu, including a win in the second round of the Madrid Open last month. Andreescu will play No. 8 Qinwen Zheng in the next round. Zheng won Olympic gold at the 2024 Summer Games in Paris. Elsewhere on Sunday, No. 24 seed Leylah Fernandez of Laval, Que., lost her third-round match 6-4, 6-2 to Marta Kostyuk of Ukraine. Kostyuk hit five aces and converted four break points, compared to one for Fernandez, en route to victory. This report by The Canadian Press was first published May 11, 2025. Your goal is to keep the reader curious and guessing at what comes next at the end of each paragraph.

Bianca Andreescu Shockingly Defeated No. 11 Seed Elena Rybakina At The Italian Open, Propelling Herself Into The Fourth Round. After A Comeback That Could Make Any Movie Director Jealous, Andreescu Took Just 87 Minutes—Not Even Enough Time For An Average Netflix Episode!+++++ At Just 24 Years Old, The Mississauga Marvel Converted 3 Break Points And Saved 5, Proving That Math Can Be Fun When Winning Is Involved. This Match Was The Canadian's First Victory Against A Top-20 Player Since The Dawn Of 2023! (Okay, Maybe Not The Dawn, But Close Enough.)+++++ Rybakina, Who Previously Had More Success Against Andreescu Than A Squirrel With A Nut, Hadn't Dropped A Set In Their Previous Three Matches. But This Time, Andreescu Brought The Fire—And Maybe A Magic Spell—To Turn The Tables. Will The "Comeback Kid" Perform Another Miracle In The Next Round?+++++ In Other Italian Open News, No. 24 Seed Leylah Fernandez Took A Dissatisfying Exit, Losing To Marta Kostyuk With A Scoreline We Can Only Describe As A Bad Hair Day: 6-4, 6-2. Meanwhile, Kostyuk Hit A Whopping 5 Aces, Proving She's Not Just A Pretty Face With A Racquet. Will Fernandez Pick Up The Pieces, Or Is This Game Best Left To The Aces?+++++

Write a short, only slightly (around 10%) sarcastically funny in the style of Rick Riordan, and quantitative news story with lots of bolded numbers on 'hbo max' with a bolded title that does not contain quotation marks nor slashes and has each word starting with a capital letter, multiple twists and turns, less than 50 words for each paragraph, with each body (not title!!) paragraph's bolded words surrounded with and so it translates to html, no bolded words nor tags in the title, the first two sentences should concisely summarize the entire story, and end each paragraph and the title with a string '+++++', make sure to end the title with string '+++++' by summarizing this article: May 14, 2025 – At the Warner Bros. Discovery Upfront presentation in New York today, it was announced that Max, the company’s premier streaming platform, will be rebranded HBO Max this summer. WBD’s streaming business has incredible momentum, turning around its profitability by almost $3B in just two years and scaling globally with 22M subscribers added over the past year, with a clear path to over 150M+ by the end of 2026. This is thanks to an enormous amount of hard work, investment and re-focusing the strategy on the programming that is working best like HBO, recent box-office movies, docuseries, certain reality series, and Max and local originals, and de-prioritizing other genres that drive less engagement or acquisition. This evolution has also been influenced by changing consumer needs, and the fact that no consumer today is saying they want more content, but most consumers are saying they want better content. With other services filling the more basic needs with volume, WBD has clearly distinguished itself through its quality and distinct stories, and no brand has done that better and more consistently over 50+ years than HBO. Returning the HBO brand into HBO Max will further drive the service forward and amplify the uniqueness that subscribers can expect from the offering. It is also a testament to WBD’s willingness to keep boldly iterating its strategy and approach – leaning heavily on consumer data and insights – to best position itself for success. David Zaslav, President and CEO of Warner Bros. Discovery, said: “The powerful growth we have seen in our global streaming service is built around the quality of our programming. Today, we are bringing back HBO, the brand that represents the highest quality in media, to further accelerate that growth in the years ahead.” During the WBD Upfront on stage at Madison Square Garden, JB Perrette, President and CEO of Streaming, and Casey Bloys, Chairman and CEO of HBO and Max Content, provided further details on the upcoming change. Perrette: “We will continue to focus on what makes us unique – not everything for everyone in a household, but something distinct and great for adults and families. It’s really not subjective, not even controversial – our programming just hits different.” Bloys: “With the course we are on and strong momentum we are enjoying, we believe HBO Max far better represents our current consumer proposition. And it clearly states our implicit promise to deliver content that is recognized as unique and, to steal a line we always said at HBO, worth paying for.” HBO Max® is the premier global streaming platform from Warner Bros. Discovery that delivers the most unique and captivating stories, ranging from the highest quality in scripted programming, movies, documentaries, true crime, adult animation, and live sports and news (where available). HBO Max is the destination for prestigious entertainment brands such as HBO, Warner Bros., Max Originals, DC, Harry Potter, A24 Films, as well as iconic shows like “Friends” and “The Big Bang Theory,” all in one place. Download assets HERE Jeff Cusson Jeff.Cusson@wbd.com Jaclyn Mandelbaum Jaclyn.Mandelbaum@wbd.com Your goal is to keep the reader curious and guessing at what comes next at the end of each paragraph.

Warner Bros. Discovery Announced That Max Will Be Rebranded As HBO Max This Summer, Because Who Doesn’t Love A Good Remake? With $3B Worth Of Profit Turnaround In Two Years, It’s Clear Someone's Been Drinking Their Corporate Success Smoothie.+++++ In The Last Year, Max Managed To Add Over 22M Subscribers Like Pizza Toppings On A Friday Night, All While Charting A Course For Over 150M By The End Of 2026. It’s Almost Like They Know What People Want! (*Spoiler Alert: It’s Not More Reality Shows.*)+++++ Apparently, Viewers Have Spoken—And Surprisingly, They Aren't Campaigning For A Greater Volume Of Content. Instead, They’re All About The Quality, The Spice Of Life, And (Perhaps) Gluten-Free Options. WBD Apparently Heard Our Pleas For Better Substance Instead Of Just Filling Up Our Watchlists With *stuff*.+++++ David Zaslav, The Grand Poobah Of Warner Bros. Discovery, Asserted That The Company’s Growth Is Rooted In Its High-Quality Programming. With Such Large Claims, Can HBO Max Live Up To The Hype, Or Will We Be Leaving With A Half-Eaten Popcorn Bag? Either Way, This Revamped Service Promises To Be Different, So Buckle Up!+++++

Write a short, only slightly (around 10%) sarcastically funny in the style of Rick Riordan, and quantitative news story with lots of bolded numbers on 'playoffs maple leafs' with a bolded title that does not contain quotation marks nor slashes and has each word starting with a capital letter, multiple twists and turns, less than 50 words for each paragraph, with each body (not title!!) paragraph's bolded words surrounded with and so it translates to html, no bolded words nor tags in the title, the first two sentences should concisely summarize the entire story, and end each paragraph and the title with a string '+++++', make sure to end the title with string '+++++' by summarizing this article: Toronto Maple Leafs head coach Craig Berube is keeping potential lineup decisions close to the vest ahead of a pivotal Game 5 against the Florida Panthers. Berube told reporters that there are some game-time decisions for the lineup, but they are not injury-related. The Leafs coach said he was contemplating changes to the lineup after his team dropped Game 4 against the Panthers. However, Berube was not revealing much as the team ran the normal lineup at practice on Tuesday while Wednesday's morning skate was optional. Usually, only the scratches participate in the optional morning skates. One player who was not on the ice was David Kampf, which suggests that he could be an option to enter Game 5. Kampf has not played since April 2 when he was injured against the Panthers. The 30-year-old was limited to 59 appearances during the regular season because of injuries, as he recorded five goals and 13 points. Your goal is to keep the reader curious and guessing at what comes next at the end of each paragraph.

With 5 Goals And 13 Points, He May Be Exactly What The Leafs Need To Turn The Tide!+++++

Write a short, only slightly (around 10%) sarcastically funny in the style of Rick Riordan, and quantitative news story with lots of bolded numbers on 'trump saudi arabia tech giants' with a bolded title that does not contain quotation marks nor slashes and has each word starting with a capital letter and is catchy and concise (less than 10 words), multiple twists and turns, less than 50 words for each paragraph, with each body (not title!!) paragraph's bolded words surrounded with and so it translates to html, no bolded words nor tags in the title, the first two sentences should concisely summarize the entire story, and end each paragraph and the title with a string '+++++', make sure to end the title with string '+++++' by summarizing this article: CNN — US President Donald Trump didn’t show up empty-handed on the first international trip of his second term. Joining him in Saudi Arabia were almost three dozen CEOs of America’s biggest companies, including Big Tech giants that signed $600 billion worth of deals. They brought some of the most coveted must-haves of the global economy: artificial intelligence (AI) chips that will power the Middle East’s biggest tech infrastructure projects, which are seen as crucial to securing the region’s post-oil future. The agreements highlight the importance of America’s AI offerings as a key bargaining chip for Trump as he seeks to project himself as a consummate dealmaker and diplomat on the world stage, as well as securing closer ties with countries in the Gulf, especially Saudi Arabia. Elon Musk, OpenAI’s Sam Altman, Nvidia’s Jensen Huang and IBM’s Arvind Krishna were all part of Trump’s entourage for his first stop in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday, where he was met on the tarmac by the kingdom’s crown prince Mohammed bin Salman. It’s a significant policy shift from former President Joe Biden, who had promised to make the kingdom a “pariah” after the murder of Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi in 2018. A US intelligence report says that the crown prince, who welcomed Trump on the royal purple carpet on Tuesday, approved the operation to capture or kill the Saudi journalist. Trump is greeted by the Saudi crown prince as he arrives at King Khalid International Airport on May 13, 2025, in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Win McNamee/Getty Images Days before the president left for his three-nation tour of the Gulf, the Trump administration announced plans to rescind a set of Biden-era curbs meant to keep AI chips out of the hands of foreign adversaries, which would have affected their sale to countries in the region. “The deals celebrated today are historic and transformative for both countries and represent a new golden era of partnership between the United States and Saudi Arabia,” the White House said in a statement Tuesday. Although Saudi Arabia is the world’s biggest oil exporter, the kingdom and neighboring countries are using money from energy sales to diversify their economies. Saudi Arabia has announced that initiatives dubbed “giga-projects” are key to the country’s Vision 2030 plan, which aims to modernize the country and wean its economy off oil. As part of those efforts, Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund, its sovereign wealth fund, announced the establishment of AI startup Humain on Monday to position the country as a “globally competitive AI hub.” Deals with Nvidia, AMD, Qualcomm AI chip designer Nvidia, the market leader, announced a strategic partnership on Tuesday with Humain to build “AI factories” in the country with a projected capacity of up to 500 megawatts. To power those facilities, Nvidia will sell several hundred thousand of its most advanced graphic processing units there over the next five years, beginning with 18,000 of its top-of-the-line GB300 Grace Blackwell chips. The Nvidia logo and lettering can be seen in Munich on the stele at one of the company's Munich headquarters. Matthias Balk/dpa/picture alliance/Getty Images “These hyperscale AI data centers will provide a secure foundational infrastructure for training

Trump Takes Tech Titans To Saudi Arabia For AI Boom+++++ In A Bold Diplomatic Play, President Trump Landed In Saudi Arabia With Nearly 36 Bigwigs From America’s Tech Giants To Seal A Staggering $600 Billion In Deals. Who Needs Oil When You Have Artificial Intelligence Chips Ready To Power The Future—And Possibly Launch A Few Satellites, Too?+++++ The Agreements Underscore Trump’s Aspiration To Be The Deal-Making Demigod Of The World Stage, While Enhancing Ties With Gulf Nations. Talk About Bridging The Gap Between Tech And Diplomacy—Or Is It Just Another Reality Show? Stay Tuned For More Plot Twists!+++++ The Crown Prince Met Trump With Open Arms And A Royal Purple Carpet—Say What You Will About Saudi Arabia, But Their Welcome Game Is Strong. Meanwhile, Just Days Before The Trip, Trump's Administration Reversed Biden-Era Barriers On AI Chips, Because Who Doesn’t Love A Good Plot Twist?+++++ With Saudi Arabia’s Vision 2030 Aiming To Diversify Its Economy Beyond Oil, The Kingdom's New AI Startup, Humain, Is Poised To Make Waves. If Nvidia's Exciting Plans To Build AI Factories With 500 MW Capabilities Don’t Spark Your Interest, What Will? Expect 18,000 Brand-New NVIDIA Chips In Five Years—Local Tech Just Got A Serious Glow-Up!+++++
